Zaradi obilnejših padavin v zahodni in osrednji Sloveniji večja verjetnost plazov
05 Nov 2019, 15:04 by STA

Zaradi obilnejših padavin, ki so po razmeroma suhem oktobru Slovenijo dosegle v začetku novembra, imajo nekatere reke velike pritoke. Kot opozarjajo na Geološkem zavodu Slovenije, je v zahodni in osrednji Sloveniji povečana tudi verjetnost zemeljskih plazov.



Prebivalci z območij, kjer so se v preteklosti že pojavljali zemeljski plazovi, naj bodo pozorni na dogajanja v tleh nad in pod objekti, zgrajenimi na pobočjih ali tik ob njih. Foto: Zdravko Primožič/FPA

LJUBLJANA > Po navedbah geološkega zavoda lahko do zemeljskih plazov pride tudi v ostalih predelih Slovenije. Verjetnost se bo povečevala sorazmerno s količino padavin. Prebivalcem na teh območjih in predvsem tam, kjer so se v preteklosti že pojavljali zemeljski plazovi, svetujejo, naj bodo pozorni na dogajanja v tleh nad in pod objekti, zgrajenimi na pobočjih ali tik ob njih. Še posebej naj bodo pozorni na sveže razpoke v opornih zidovih, posedanje in zdrse zemljine ter tudi na znake zamakanja vode na zemljišču.
Agencija za okolje (Arso) je že dopoldne poročala o velikih pretokih rek s povirjem v Julijskih Alpah, v Kamniško Savinjskih Alpah, v Idrijsko Cerkljanskem in Škofjeloškem hribovju ter v porečju Vipave. Naraščajo tudi reke ponekod drugod po Sloveniji, zlasti v osrednji in južni Sloveniji lahko pride tudi do razlivanj posameznih rek. Te bodo po napovedih največje pretoke dosegle v večernih urah in v noči na sredo. Ob močnejših krajevnih nalivih lahko hitro narastejo tudi hudourniški vodotoki.
Vremenoslovci so tudi za popoldan napovedali oblačno vreme s pogostimi padavinami in nevihtami predvsem na zahodu, krajevno tudi dolgotrajnejšimi nalivi. Pihal bo okrepljen južni do jugozahodni veter, ob morju jugo. Dež bo v prvem delu noči večinoma ponehal. V sredo bo na vzhodu deloma sončno in povečini suho vreme, drugod bodo občasno krajevne padavine, deloma plohe, na zahodu tudi kakšna nevihta.

Heavy rainfall in western and central Slovenia makes avalanches more likely
05 Nov 2019, 15:04 by STA

Due to the heavy rainfall that reached Slovenia in early November after relatively dry October, some rivers have large tributaries. According to the Geological Survey of Slovenia, landslides are also more likely in western and central Slovenia.



Residents from areas where landslides have occurred in the past should be alert to developments in the ground above and below the structures built on or near the slopes. Photo: Zdravko Primozic / FPA

LJUBLJANA> According to the Geological Survey, landslides can also occur in other parts of Slovenia. The probability will increase in proportion to the amount of precipitation. Residents in these areas, and especially where landslides have occurred in the past, are advised to be alert to developments in the soil above and below the structures built on or near the slopes. Particular attention should be paid to fresh cracks in the retaining walls, the settling and slipping of the soil, as well as signs of water displacement on the land.
The Environmental Agency (Arso) has already reported large river flows in the morning in the Julian Alps, in the Kamnik Savinja Alps, in the Idrija Cerkno and Skofja Loka Hills and in the Vipava Basin. Rivers are also increasing elsewhere in Slovenia, especially in central and southern Slovenia, as well as spills of individual rivers. These are projected to reach maximum flows in the evening and on Wednesday nights. With heavy local rainfall, torrential watercourses can also grow rapidly.
Weather forecasters also forecast cloudy weather in the afternoon, with frequent rainfall and thunderstorms mainly in the west, as well as longer-term rainfall in the area. There will be a strong south to southwest wind, with the south wind. The rain will mostly disappear during the first part of the night. On Wednesday it will be partly sunny in the east and mostly dry weather, with occasional heavy rainfall occasionally, partly in the west, with some thunderstorms in the west.
